timeline.bodyText: Nothing to do with dependency updates, but what's the purpose of this function? context.getString(R.string.finish) is already explicative, readable and not long, so why encapsulate it in a function?
timeline.author: Stypox

replies.bodyText: I was wondering that as well… I'll fix it later today
replies.author: wb9688

timeline.bodyText: Why did you change the order? And if we change the order, it should be for lexicographical order.
timeline.author: B0pol

replies.bodyText: I changed the order to be the same as down there. Down there I changed the order in a way that seems more logical to me.
replies.author: wb9688

timeline.bodyText: This is also unrelated to dependency updates, but this block of code should be replaced by @NotNull parameters, or just removed alltoghether, because a NullPointerException would be thrown anyway crashing the app, so it makes no sense to check for nullity and then do not do anything different.
timeline.author: Stypox

replies.bodyText: That's why I made it an IllegalArgumentException, though making it @NotNull is probably better indeed
replies.author: wb9688

timeline.bodyText: Please (re-)add the comment about the delay. The new naming is less understandable.
timeline.author: TobiGr
timeline.diffHunk:
